headline.main: At the Talk Center, they talk of drugs; They talk of drugs (cont.)

docs.abstract: Article discusses work of young volunteers at White Plains, NY, Talk Center, where phones are manned to receive calls from youthful drug addicts; illus
docs.lead_paragraph: IT is 7 P.M. and the second-hand electric heater is already giving hints that it will be a cold night in the three-room apartment. The telephone rings. Cindy Nast puts down her physics book -- she has a test the next day -- and answers it. "Hello, drug help line."
